title: Nathan Wood (rugby league)
text:
Nathan Wood (born 24 January 1972 in <a href="Darlinghurst%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Darlinghurst, New South Wales</a>) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer. Wood played in almost every position during his career, from to .
Playing career.
Wood was a <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South's</a> junior but made his first-grade début for Balmain in round 17 of the 1993 season. Between 1993 and 2001 he played for the <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain Tigers</a>, <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> and the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League%20premiership">NSWRL premiership</a>, <a href="Australian%20Rugby%20League">Australian Rugby League</a> and <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>. He then moved to the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> and played for the <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a> and the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a>. He retired at the end of 2005 due to injury, moving back to Australia to care for his two sons Raecin and Kaede.
During his Warrington career Nat was in the victorious team that played the final game at Wilderspool Stadium in 2003 and was the first try scorer at the new Halliwell Jones Stadium in 2004, both games were against his old club Wakefield.
Wood appeared as a challenger on the 2008 series of <a href="Gladiators%20%282008%20Australian%20TV%20series%29">Gladiators</a>.
Wood is the son of former <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a>, <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">Norths</a> and <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">Souths</a> , <a href="Barry%20Wood%20%28rugby%20league%29">Barry Wood</a>, and brother of "The Contender Australia" winner and former Souths player <a href="Garth%20Wood">Garth Wood</a>.
